intro: Adenandra acuta, commonly known as the sharp-leaved adenandra, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Adenandra acuta is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as birds and insects.
